description: Variation of condition 7 of planning permission dated 17 October 2003 (ref: P031366) in order to permit clear glazing to windows on the second, third and fourth floors of the south east elevation and the fourth floor windows of the south west elevation (the current permission requires these windows to be obscure glazed).
decision_conditions:
FORMAL DECISION:  The Planning Inspectorate allow the appeal and grant planning permission for a change of use of ground floor and all upper floors from offices (B1) to three, 2-bedroom self-contained flats (C3) and one live/work unit, incorporating, alterations; including new windows, rendering brickwork and painting brickwork, at 2A Fairbridge Road, Islington, London, N19 in accordance with the application reference P031366 dated 24th June 2003, without compliance with condition number 7 previously imposed on planning permission reference P031366 dated 17th October 2003 but subject to the other conditions imposed therein, so far as the same are still subsisting and capable of the effect and subject to the following new condition:

The development hereby approved shall be completed in all respects in accordance with the plans and details submitted and approved with the exception of the provision of partially obscure glazing to windows on the third and fourth floors of the south-east elevation and the fourth floor windows of the south-west elevation.
